[W] Bubble (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
cards.attack2:
[1W] Withdraw
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks will happen.)

cards.description: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.attack1:
[1P] Psychic (10+)
Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.
cards.attack2:
[PP] Barrier
Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

cards.attack1: [2] Smash Kick (20)
cards.attack2: [RR] Flame Tail (30)

If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.

[G] Horn Hazard (30)

cards.name: Bill
cards.description: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.attack1:
[L] Thundershock (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
cards.attack2:
[1L] Thunderpunch (30+)
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.attack1:
[2G] Thrash (30+)
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.
cards.attack2:
[GGG] Toxic (20)
The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

cards.name: Diglett
cards.attack1: [F] Dig (10)
cards.attack2: [FF] Mud Slap (30)

cards.name: Onix
cards.attack1: [F] Rock Throw (10)
cards.attack2:
[FF] Harden
During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Koffing
cards.attack1:
[GG] Foul Gas (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.description: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.attack1:
[2] Scrunch
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
cards.attack2:
[4] Double-edge (80)
Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.attack1:
[2G] Double Kick (30x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
cards.attack2: [2GG] Horn Drill (50)

cards.name: Computer Search
cards.description: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Alakazam
cards.description:
Pokemon Power: Damage Swap
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokemon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
cards.attack1:
[PPP] Confuse Ray (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.attack1:
[1LL] Thunder Wave (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
cards.attack2:
[2LL] Selfdestruct (80)
Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Poliwrath
cards.attack1:
[1WW] Water Gun (30+)
Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.
cards.attack2:
[2WW] Whirlpool (40)
If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Kadabra
cards.attack1:
[PP] Recover
Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.
cards.attack2: [1PP] Super Psy (50)

cards.name: Gastly
cards.attack1:
[P] Sleeping Gas
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
cards.attack2:
[1P] Destiny Bond
Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokemon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokemon.

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.attack1:
[F] Sand-attack (10)
If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.description:
Provides 2 Colorless energy.
Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.

cards.name: Lass
cards.description: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

cards.name: Gust of Wind
cards.description: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with his or her Active Pokemon.

cards.name: Porygon
cards.attack1:
[1] Conversion 1
If the Defending Pokemon has a Weakness, you may change it to ta type of your choice other than Colorless.
cards.attack2:
[2] Conversion 2
Change Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

cards.name: Poliwag
cards.attack1:
[W] Water Gun (10+)
Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd don't count.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.attack1: [3] Slash (30)
cards.attack2:
[1RR] Flamethrower (50)
Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

cards.attack1:
[P] Doubleslap (10x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
cards.attack2:
[1PP] Meditate (20+)
Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

cards.name: Haunter
cards.attack1:
[P] Hypnosis
The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
cards.attack2:
[PP] Dream Eater (50)
You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokemon is Asleep.

cards.attack1:
[3] Twineedle (30x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

[GGG] Poison Sting (40)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

cards.attack1:
[3] Slam (30x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
cards.attack2:
[4] Hyper Beam (20)
If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
cards.description: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokemon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.attack1:
[2] Whirlwind (20)
If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)
cards.attack2:
[3] Mirror Move
If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokemon.

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.attack1:
[1RR] Flamethrower (50)
Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.
cards.attack2:
[2RR] Take Down (80)
Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Starmie
cards.attack1:
[WW] Recover
Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.
cards.attack2:
[2W] Star Freeze (20)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.attack1:
[1] Sing
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
cards.attack2:
[3] Metronome
Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.attack1: [1FF] Slash (40)
cards.attack2:
[FFFF] Earthquake (70)
Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.attack1:
[1] Leek Slap (30)
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).
cards.attack2: [3] Pot Smash (30)

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.attack1:
[L] Thunder Wave (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
cards.attack2:
[1L] Selfdestruct (40)
Does 10 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.attack1:
[G] Poison Sting (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Pokedex
cards.description: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.attack1: [1] Pound (10)
cards.attack2:
[PP] Confuse Ray (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

cards.name: Blastoise
cards.description:
Pokemon Power: Rain Dance
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokemon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
cards.attack1:
[WWW] Hydro Pump (40+)
Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

cards.name: Pokemon Trader
cards.description: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokemon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokemon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.attack1:
[2L] Agility (20)
Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.
cards.attack2:
[1LLL] Thunder (60)
Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Dewgong
cards.attack1: [1WW] Aurora Beam (50)
cards.attack2:
[2WW] Ice Beam (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.attack1: [1R] Flare (20)

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.description: Your Active Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

cards.name: Venusaur
cards.description:
Pokemon Power: Energy Trans
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokemon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
cards.attack1: [GGGG] Solarbeam (60)

cards.name: Magmar
cards.attack1: [RR] Fire Punch (30)
cards.attack2:
[1RR] Flamethrower (50)
Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.description:
Pokemon Power: Buzzap
At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokemon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokemon) that provides 2 energy of that type. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
cards.attack1:
[LLL] Electric Shock (50)
Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.attack1:
[2] Whirlwind (10)
If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.description: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokemon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokemon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokemon.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.attack1: [1] Tackle (10)
cards.attack2:
[W] Flail (10x)
Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.attack1:
[1FF] Karate Chop (50-)
Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.
cards.attack2:
[2FF] Submission (60)
Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Seel
cards.attack1: [W] Headbutt (10)

cards.name: Pokemon Center
cards.description: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokemon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokemon.

cards.name: Metapod
cards.attack1:
[2] Stiffen
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
cards.attack2:
[GG] Stun Spore (20)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.attack1:
[2] Stiffen
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
cards.attack2:
[GG] Poisonpowder (20)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.attack1:
[1LLL] Thunder (60)
Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.
cards.attack2:
[LLLL] Thunderbolt (100)
Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.attack1: [1] Tackle (10)

cards.name: Poliwhirl
cards.attack1:
[WW] Amnesia
Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
cards.attack2:
[1WW] Doubleslap (30x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.attack1:
[1] Fury Attack (10x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Defender
cards.description: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokemon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Scoop Up
cards.description: Choose 1 of your Pokemon in play and return its Basic Pokemon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.attack1:
[G] String Shot (10)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.attack2:
[3] Super Fang (?)
Does damage to the Defending Pokemon equal to half the Defending Pokemon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

cards.name: Dratini
cards.attack1: [1] Pound (10)

cards.name: Pokemon Breeder
cards.description: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokemon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokemon anyway.

cards.name: Devolution Spray
cards.description: Choose 1 of your own Pokemon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokemon. That Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

cards.name: Charizard
cards.description:
Pokemon Power: Burn
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
cards.attack1:
[RRRR] Fire Spin (100)
Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Imposter Professor Oak
cards.description: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.attack1:
[1G] Bind (20)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
cards.attack2:
[GGG] Poisonpowder (20)
The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Pokemon Flute
cards.description: Choose 1 Basic Pokemon card from your opponent's discard pile and put it onto his or her Bench. (You can't play Pokemon Flute if your opponent's Bench is full.)

cards.name: Revive
cards.description: Put 1 Basic Pokemon card from your discard pile onto your bench. Put damage counters on that Pokemon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). <em>(You can't play Revive if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Clefairy Doll
cards.description: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokemon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts as a Pokemon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.

cards.name: Maintenance
cards.description: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

cards.name: Item Finder
cards.description: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
